angle_summary: Woodfire Westport is generating strong reputation-led traffic through 573 Google reviews but has no contact form, booking system, or enquiry pathway on the site. Adding a basic conversion layer — contact form, click-to-call, and reservation system — would directly connect that earned credibility to seated customers.
proof_points: No contact form and no booking system are present — visitors currently have no way to enquire or reserve from the website
573 Google reviews at a 4.6 rating confirm significant public-facing demand that the current site cannot convert
Mobile PageSpeed of 74 and mobile UX rated ok indicate a functional but unconverted mobile experience with no enquiry route for on-the-go visitors
offer_scope_points: Add a contact or enquiry form to the homepage or a dedicated contact section
Implement a click-to-call button visible on mobile
Integrate an online reservation or booking system with confirmation flow
personalisation_notes: 573 Google reviews at 4.6 — one of the strongest public review profiles for a restaurant in the Westport area — makes this a high-credibility lead where conversion framing lands naturally
The site runs on WordPress with a single-page layout and no dynamic sections — the conversion sprint scope is achievable without structural changes
suggested_cta: Would you have 15 minutes this week for a quick call — I can walk you through exactly what we would add and how it works?
avoid_saying: Your website is broken or missing basic features — frame it as an opportunity to connect existing demand to action, not as criticism of the current site
Anything implying the business is losing significant revenue — this risks triggering defensiveness before a relationship is established
unknowns_to_confirm: Does the business currently take bookings by phone or through a third-party platform — this determines whether to recommend a standalone booking system or an integration
Who manages the WordPress site and is there an existing maintenance arrangement in place
